titleStmt.title: Ireland's amazement, or, The heavens armado being a true relation of two strange and prodigious wonders or apparitions, which was seene over the city of Dublin, the one Decemb. 24 and the other Decemb. 30, 1641 : which appeared in the heavens like to an host of armed men with great ordnance as it were giving fire and all other furniture for warre, with other fearefull signes : with strange visions put the city and inhabitants into great astonishment and feare : and may serve as a warning peece for England in these troublesome and distracted times.

Ireland's amazement, or, The heavens armado being a true relation of two strange and prodigious wonders or apparitions, which was seene over the city of Dublin, the one Decemb. 24 and the other Decemb. 30, 1641 : which appeared in the heavens like to an host of armed men with great ordnance as it were giving fire and all other furniture for warre, with other fearefull signes : with strange visions put the city and inhabitants into great astonishment and feare : and may serve as a warning peece for England in these troublesome and distracted times.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
